paper_title.en: Stable extendibility of vector bundles over lens spaces mod 3 and the stable splitting problem

description.en: Let L(n)(3) denote the (2n + 1)-dimensional standard lens space mod 3. In this paper, we study the conditions for a given real vector bundle over L(n)(3) to be stably extendible to L(m)(3) for every m >= n, and establish the formula on the power zeta(k) = zeta circle times ... circle times zeta (k-fold) of a real vector bundle over L(n)(3). Moreover, we answer the stable splitting problem for real vector bundles zeta over L(n)(3) by means of arithmetic conditions. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Stable extendibility of vector bundles over lens spaces mod 3 and the stable splitting problem

description.en: Let L(n)(3) denote the (2n + 1)-dimensional standard lens space mod 3. In this paper, we study the conditions for a given real vector bundle over L(n)(3) to be stably extendible to L(m)(3) for every m >= n, and establish the formula on the power zeta(k) = zeta circle times ... circle times zeta (k-fold) of a real vector bundle over L(n)(3). Moreover, we answer the stable splitting problem for real vector bundles zeta over L(n)(3) by means of arithmetic conditions. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Stable extendibility of vector bundles over RP<sup>n</sup> and the stable splitting problem （共著）
paper_title.en: Stable extendibility of vector bundles over RPn and the stable splitting problem

description.en: Let F be the real number field R or the complex number field C, and let RPn denote the real projective n-space. In this paper, we study the conditions for a given F-vector bundle over RPn to be stably extendible to RPm for every m > n, and establish the formulas on the power zeta(r) = zeta circle times ... circle times zeta (r-fold) of an F-vector bundle zeta over RPn. Our results are improvements of the previous papers [T. Kobayashi, H. Yamasaki, T. Yoshida, The power of the tangent bundle of the real projective space, its complexification and extendibility, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 134 (2005) 303-310] and [Y. Hemmi, T. Kobayashi, Min Lwin Oo, The power of the normal bundle associated to an immersion of RPn, its complexification and extendibility, Hiroshima Math. J. 37 (2007) 101-109]. Furthermore, we answer the stable splitting problem for F-vector bundles over RPn by means of arithmetic conditions. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: The action of the Steenrod algebra on the cohomology of p-compact groups（共著）
paper_title.en: The Action of the Steenrod Algebra on the Cohomology of p-Compact Groups

description.en: In the present paper, we determine the action of the Steenrod operations on the cohomology of simply connected p-compact groups with no p-torsion in the integral homologies for an odd prime p. To do so we study simple simply connected p-compact groups since any simply connected p-compact group with no p-torsion in the integral homology is a product of such p-compact groups.

paper_title.en: Stable extendibility of vector bundles over RPn and the stable splitting problem

description.en: Let F be the real number field R or the complex number field C, and let RPn denote the real projective n-space. In this paper, we study the conditions for a given F-vector bundle over RPn to be stably extendible to RPm for every m > n, and establish the formulas on the power zeta(r) = zeta circle times ... circle times zeta (r-fold) of an F-vector bundle zeta over RPn. Our results are improvements of the previous papers [T. Kobayashi, H. Yamasaki, T. Yoshida, The power of the tangent bundle of the real projective space, its complexification and extendibility, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 134 (2005) 303-310] and [Y. Hemmi, T. Kobayashi, Min Lwin Oo, The power of the normal bundle associated to an immersion of RPn, its complexification and extendibility, Hiroshima Math. J. 37 (2007) 101-109]. Furthermore, we answer the stable splitting problem for F-vector bundles over RPn by means of arithmetic conditions. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: The power of the normal bundle associated to an immersion of RP<sup>n</sup>, its complexification and extendibility （共著）
paper_title.en: The power of the normal bundle associated to an immersion of RPn, its complexification and extendibility

description.en: The purpose of this paper is to establish the formulas on the power of the normal bundle associated to an immersion of the real projective space RPn in the Euclidean space Rn+k, and apply them to the problem of extendibility and stable extendibility. Furthermore, we give an example of a 2-dimensional R-vector bundle over RP2 that is stably extendible to RP3 but is not extendible to RP3.

paper_title.ja: Higher homotopy commutativity of H-spaces and the permuto-associahedra（共著）

paper_title.en: Higher homotopy commutativity of H-spaces and the permuto-associahedra(jointly worked)
H-spaces as direct product factors of loop spaces

description.en:
Any H-space X can be imbedded in the loop space of its suspension ΩΣX as a direct product factor: X×Y≃Ω ΣX for some Y. In this paper, we first study a condition on which the image of the cohomology suspension σ*(x)∈H* (ΩΣX

paper_title.en: H-spaces as direct product factors of loop spaces

description.en: Any H-space X can be imbedded in the loop space of its suspension OmegaSigmaX as a direct product factor: X x Y similar or equal to OmegaSigmaX for some Y. In this paper, we first study a condition on which the image of the cohomology suspension sigma* (x) is an element of H* (OmegaSigmaX; F) for any cohomology class x is an element of H* (X; F) is identified with x circle times 1 is an element of H*(X; F) circle times H*(Y; F), where F is a field. We also give an explanation of any class in H*(OmegaSigmaX; F) as a class in H*(Y; F) circle times H*(Y; F). We next generalize this argument to A(n)-spaces. We show that any A(n)-space X can be imbedded in the loop space of its projective n-1-space Pn-1X as a direct product factor: X x Yn-1 similar or equal to OmegaP(n-1)X for some Yn-1. Then we study a condition on which the class sigma*((x) over cap) is an element of H*(OmegaP(n-1)X; F) for any A(n-1)-class x is an element of H* (X; F) with epsilon(n-1)((x) over cap) = x is identified with x circle times 1 is an element of H*(X; F) circle times H*(Yn-1;F), where epsilon(n-1) : SigmaX --> Pn-1X is the inclusion. (C) 2002 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Cohomology Rings of 3-local Finite H-spaces（共著）

description.en: Given a simply connected 3-local finite H-space X with mod 3 homology an associative ring, the even degree algebra generators of H*(X; F-3) lie in degrees 8 and 20 and the homology ring H.(X; F3) is primitively generated. Further, the action of P-1 on certain odd degree generators of H*(X; F-3) is specified. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
